newDescription: Twister’s Barn is a 5400sqft indoor arena at Ettington Dog Walking Meadows. It has a woodchip base and is perfect for winter training or to escape the heat in the summer. Sessions are 45minutes with a 15 minute crossover and parking is in a secure parking area (5’6″ fencing) with no visibility to the surrounding yard. There’s lots of great agility equipment to try and everything is organised to the same excellent standards provided at Ettington’s secure fields. currentDescription: Dog walking field at Phoebe’s Place. Visit for a safe, enclosed space for your dogs.
newDescription: ‘Phoebe’s Place’ is a super dog field located approximately 7 miles from both Stevenage and Hitchin in Hertfordshire. It is 3.5 acres and offers countryside views in a farm setting and is surrounded by very well installed 5ft fencing. Booking and Accessing ‘Phoebe’s Place’ Booking is through a secure website and sessions are 50 minutes. Pricing varies for the number of dogs you chose to bring and there is a weekday and weekend price. Access is a little confusing if using the postcode so to easily locate the entrance, use the What3Words link on this page. Once you’re at the gate you travel down the farm track for 500m. It’s worth noting that if you have a car with limited ground clearance, you may want to take it easy as this track is a little rough but not impassable. Once you reach the end of the track there is a little sign directing you to the parking area directly outside the field gate. What is ‘Phoebe’s Place’ Like? Phoebe’s Place is a really nice field and suitable for all but the most athletic dogs with really nicely installed 5ft fencing. The photos I took really don’t do it justice because it was absolutely tipping it down! The field feels bigger than it’s 3.5 acre size and has nice thick grass. It is almost entirely surrounded by hedges and trees with a few additional locked gates for machinery access – One field was arable and the other looks to be a hay field – no livestock present at the time of my visit. The entrance was a little muddy (November) which is to be expected but as it doesn’t have in field parking, this isn’t as bad as many fields at this time of year. There are a few agricultural obstacles scattered around the field for interest – one of whch you may want to limit access to – piled crates with the slats presenting a hazard for any dogs climbing on them (see image). There is a picnic bench, dog waste disposal bins and water provided in a small bowser. Is ‘Phoebe’s Place’ Secure? This field is classified as ‘enclosed’ however the 5ft fencing is more than adequate for many dogs with a smaller aperture at the bottom of the net preventing small dogs and puppies squeezing through the fence. The fence has been really well installed and the entire fence is visible – the gate is 6ft+ weldmesh and is flush with the ground – no gaps for smaller escape artists. Things you should know about ‘Phoebe’s Place’ Phoebe’s Place is in a rural location and is very peaceful The field undulates and feels bigger than it’s 3.5 acre size Accessing the location itself requires driving down a few narrow roads but there are plenty of passing places Notes for Reactive Dog Owners: The location is within a farm, set back a field’s distance from the road, is surrounded by mature vegetation, and with few potential distractions There are no public rights of way passing in the imediatel area of the field One thing to note is that the parking is not enclosed so dogs must remain on the lead until in side the field Photos © British Dog Fields All media is the copyright of the listed facility or where reviewed the copyright of British Dog Fields. Gilbert’s Gallop is series of enclosed paddocks set over 1.5 acres situated approximately 11 miles north west of central Leicester. It’s very easy to access from the M1 so great for anyone on the move looking for a stop off. Updated: 10/02/23 Booking and Accessing Gilbert’s Gallop Booking is through a secure website – there are various options to add additional households, early-riser discounts and package offers. You access the field from the main farm track which is signposted from the road and turn left as you enter the yard. Here there is parking outside the field (location specified in the terms and conditions) and also space for one car inside an enclosed pen. Just be aware that because the gate opens inwards, you need to drive fully in to ensure you can close the gate behind you. Double check the space if you have a long wheel based vehicle. There is a combination lock on the first gate and the option to lock yourself into the fields on the secondary pedestrian gate which I would recommend using. What is Gilbert’s Gallop Like? Gilbert’s Gallop is a series of interlinked paddocks on the edge of a farm complex with one large play area, an area dedicated to good quality agility equipment and a separate area that has a mound overlooking the pony fields. You have access to all three areas for your booking and can restrict access to the mounded area should you wish. The fencing is 5ft stock fencing with the addition of a top line so may be unsuitable for small dogs so I recommend a perimeter walk in this field (as with all fields) prior to letting your dogs run free. There is plenty of enrichment (see photos) with hay bales and jumps in the main area as well as plenty of dog waste bins and fresh water available from containers. There was plenty to keep the dogs interested without having to reach for a ball! The agility area is comprehensive and if your dog is not experienced I would suggest that you avoid this as some of the equipment is quite big. The mound offers lovely views and the position of the field is gorgeous – surrounded by trees and hedges. One feature we were concerned about was the addition of two large, low trampolines with exposed metal springs. The existence of these is highlighted in the terms and conditions however, having not experienced this type of thing before and being excited, both of our dogs jumped on and slid across the surface catching their feet in the springs. I would have preferred these items not to have been a free-access item so that I could have controlled their access to them. Is Gilbert’s Gallop Secure? The fencing at Gilbert’s Gallop is 5ft with a top line. It’s made up of two lengths of stock fencing in many places and is not under tension. Whilst this is suitable for many dogs, this is not considered secure by our definition (see home page for definitions). Things you should know about Gilbert’s Gallop This field is excellent for dogs who have some experience with agility as there’s a lot to get stuck into The location is super for locals but also for anyone travelling on the M1 as a stop off Notes for Reactive Dog Owners: This field has some things that owners of reactive dogs and escape artists should be aware of: The field is surrounded by pony paddocks with shared fence boundaries – with the ponies were placid, our dogs did react to them as they were very close to the fence The field is on a working farm with traffic passing on a track and on the main road outside – this is obscured by hedges but in autumn when the hedges have died back a little, there was noise and movement Check the fencing carefully if you have escape artisits All media is the copyright of the listed facility or where reviewed the copyright of British Dog Fields. currentDescription:
2ND PLACE: BRITISH DOG FIELD OF THE YEAR

Grove Farm, Ettington
newDescription: Ettington is the gold standard of secure dog walking fields and it’s evident when you arrive that this is a facility run by people who truly understand the requirements of a secure field. Grove Farm is easy to find, located just south of Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire. It has three excellent fields, all different and an indoor training bran. Links to the other facilities can be found at the bottom of the page. Booking and Accessing Puppy’s Corner Secure Dog Field To access Puppy’s Corner you follow the farm track from the main road, passed the farm complex (follow the signs) and up to the entrance gate – it’s approximately half a mile and you can’t miss it. As with all fields at Ettington, you will meet the owner Charlie for your first visit – even if you have visited another of their fields previously, each field is unique and this meet and greet is really useful to get an idea of the layout of these enormous fields. Secure online booking is simple – for ‘Puppy’s’ there is the choice of 45 minute or 60 minute sessions. What Is Puppy’s Corner Like? Puppy’s Corner is the newest of the secure dog fields at Ettington and offers 33 acres of flat pasture, woodland and a swimming pond. This field is the most suitable of the Ettington fields for those with mobility challenges but still able to walk a farm field. As with the other facilities at Ettington, Puppy’s corner is drive-in, with a large grassy area for dogs to go to the toilet, before entering the main facility. This fully enclosed car park also houses the large water bowser for washing post-pond and fresh drinking water in a separate container. There are some lovely natural and agricultural obstacles and perches throughout the paddocks and the woodland is at the far end of the 33 acre plot. The pond is fenced and deep enough for a swim with shallow sides for those a little more wary. Washing is sometimes required after a dip as the clay can get a bit sticky on drying! The views from Puppy’s Corner stretch for miles and this is a really restful location for those looking for a good old run around in the fresh air. Is Puppy’s Corner at Ettington Secure Dog Fields Secure? The fencing is 180cm and well maintained with daily checks which is very reassuring. Things You Should Know about Puppy’s Corner The field is HUGE but flat so easy to get around The field is separated with stock fencing to partition your walk and ensure you can keep track of your dog The gate code is change daily for your security Notes for Reactive Dog Owners: Ettington operates a 15 minute changeover buffer which means you should not cross previous or following users. In our experience, this works extremely well and we have never crossed paths with other users in many visits. Puppy’s Corner has a farm track that runs partially alongside one short length of the field – those with very reactive dogs may prefer to use Horse Meadow or Pudding Furlong for this reason. Field Notes Dog Field 1 is secured with fences ranging from 5ft – 7ft tall as well as hedgerows and trees to provide privacy and low visibility. Field 1 is well maintained with grass cut at different levels, the walking paths for humans cut short and wide enough for pleasant and easy access. The tall grass sections are left for dogs to run through and to explore the wildness of this beautiful field. Field 1 has access to the lake and it has dog-friendly access with the water level at its deepest at 5ft. Field 1 & Field 2 share access to the lake, the lake is divided in the middle dogs are not able to swim across. Last Review Date: May 2023 Beulah View Secure Dog Fields is a 3.5 acre field with a beautiful view over rolling hills located 4 miles from Leeds City Centre. This field is fenced to 1.8m all around and has secure parking for 2 cars. The gates are also 1.8m. Booking and Accessing Beulah View Secure Dog Field Booking is through a secure website and sessions are 45 minutes long allowing for a strict 15 minute gap between users. Access is very straight forward – the W3W link and Google maps pin will both take you directly to the gate – it’s situated off Hall Lane and the track to the field is suitable for heavier vehicles too. You pull off the road onto the track and drive up to the first gate. This gate is padlocked. Once you drive in, you secure this gate and use the pedestrian access gate to reach the main field. What is Beulah View Secure Dog Field Like? Beulah View dog field is unusual in that it is a beautiful field that overlooks a major city! The views stretch for miles over West Yorkshire and it really is a lovely spot. The grass is mown beautifully with meandering paths through longer grass providing plenty of sniffles. It’s a rolling hill so not a very challenging walk but something to be mindful of if you are less mobile. This field is new at the time of writing and there will be additions to the field through the summer months – this includes natural play features and enrichment. There are poo bins but no water so you need to remember to bring your own. Is Beulah View Dog Field Secure? This field is fenced to 1.8m and also has weld mesh gates., the netting is 5cm x 10cm so is suitable for most dogs (See image for fence netting). The car park is a secure pen for safe release and has a good gravel surface. Things you should know about Beulah View Secure Dog Field The view is really unusual for a dog field and the undulations mean that you never really even feel like you’re fenced in Beulah View has been created on permanent pasture so is wonderfully grassy! This field is very easily accessible and will be a real treat for people in the area looking for somewhere safe – you can even walk here with relative ease. newDescription: Field Notes The Bark Park of Higham is just over an acre dog field set in a Countryside setting. Fully equipped with 6-foot enclosed fences, tyres tunnel, jumping logs, a shelter for rain protection, sand pit for your dog’s enjoyment, posing platforms, and a water station. We also have in field parking and a seating area. The field is located within an enclosed 10 acre of farm land. There is a double gate entry with first gate at top of track. The field is located at end of track with own gate which has to be locked at all times. Parking is then within the dog field. currentDescription: Clover Hill Farm, Steart Lane, Somerton, TA11 7BD
newDescription: Creaton Dog Walking Park is a secure dog walking field 8 miles north of Northampton with beautiful views of the Northamptonshire countryside. This dog field is approximately 1 acre and fenced to just over 6ft all round with deer fencing and rabbit mesh at the based so suitable for the smallest dogs. Booking and Accessing Creaton Dog Walking Park Booking Creaton Dog Walking Park is very simple through a secure online booking system and you will receive a booking confirmation via email. There isn’t a lock on the field gate so no code is required. Access to the field is very straight forward and both Google Maps and the what3words listed here will take you to the farm entrance. There is also a sign on the main road. Once on the farm road you will see the field in front of you. The is secure parking both within the airlock and within the field itself – this is well secured with over 6ft weld mesh gates. What is Creaton Dog Park like? This is a great exercise paddock – at around 1 acre (square shape) it has plenty of space to throw a ball. There is a log in the field and some weave poles but you might want bring toys for enrichment. The grass is thick and kept short so is suitable for buggies and people who aren’t very steady on their feet. There are lovely views for miles over the countryside from this elevated position so you might need extra layers on cold days! Is Creaton Dog Walking Park Secure? This field is surrounded with just over 6ft deer fencing with rabbit mesh at the base. Access is through a set of two 6ft welded mesh vehicle gates. Useful Information About Creaton Dog Walking Park Easy to access and centrally located Very good value at £8.50 per hour for up to 3 dogs Lovely views over countryside and farmland Use the What3Words location for the main farm entrance as this is not signposted at the entrance There is no water so bring a bowl but there is a dog waste bin and there are bags available Notes For Reactive Dog Owners For any movement reactive dogs, there is a relatively busy main road within ear shot and eye sight through the hedge – this will not be visible when the hedge is in full leaf but can be seen in early spring when we visited The farm road passes the field and several cars passed during our visit In the very far distance there is a used footpath across the surrounding field – no doubt not visible when the crops are up but a consideration for any sight hounds with a high alter-ness Photos: © British Dog Fields All media is the copyright of the listed facility or where reviewed the copyright of British Dog Fields.
